Distribution and dynamics of mangrove forests of South Asia
column112: Giri et al. is a large remote sensing study examining change in mangrove area in all South Asian countries (India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka). Reports 92,135 ha of deforested mangroves over all of these areas, so net loss, despite some gain between 2000-2012. Locations and coordinates reported are not exact -- they are locations of case studies within paper, which uses landsat to examine change in mangrove area for all south asian countries. Reported gain in Sri Lanka during this period is only 1 ha

There is hope for achieving ambitious Atlantic Forest restoration commitments
column112: Remote sensing paper that used 5 criteria to assess restoration in Atlantic forest: "To estimate the total amount of “restored forest” (defined here as native forests under either passive or active recovery that may not have yet reached the attributes of reference ecosystems)  between 2011 and 2017, we used a 30 m resolution land use and cover mapping product (“Mapbiomas”, version 3.0; http://mapbiomas.org/pages/database/mapbiomas_collection). The area should: (i) be previously classified as agriculture or pasture for at least five consecutive years; (ii) have at least five connected pixels also classified as restored forest; (iii) be classified as forest in 2017; (iv) be classified as forest for at least three consecutive years; and (v) should not be a commercial tree plantation. The Pact detected 906,452 ha of degraded/deforested lands under restoration from 2011 to 2015 (and maintained up to 2017) within the Atlantic Forest. The restored forest classification accuracy was 78%, with most misclassification arising from commercial tree plantations (14%) and old-growth forest (6%). On this basis we estimate that 673,510 and 740,555 ha of forest was restored between 2011 and 2015. A preliminary estimation performed with the Pact's database of restoration projects suggests that nearly 300,000 ha of restored forests have been established through active restoration interventions by its ?350 members." Used conservative number of 673,510- 300k for natural regeneration, and 300k for active ecological restoration

column6: Distribution and dynamics of mangrove forests of South Asia
column112: Giri et al. is a large remote sensing study examining change in mangrove area in all South Asian countries (India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka). Reports 92,135 ha of deforested mangroves over all of these areas, so net loss, despite some gain between 2000-2012. Locations and coordinates reported are not exact -- they are locations of case studies within paper, which uses landsat to exam change in mangrove area for all south asian countries. Reported gain in Sri Lanka during this period is only 1 ha
